He has been used occasionally in competitive play, but not often. It's irrelevant though.

Professional play and Solo Q are not synonymous. Not even in Challenger, according to the few streamers I've seen comment on it (Bjergson: Darius is good in Solo Q, Dyrus: Blitzcrank is a Solo Q god).

Well, LCS doesn't exactly determine viability in Solo Q. You have to remember that in Solo Q there exists a bare minimum amount of coordination until you get to high Platinum. This is why champions like Tryndamere, Shaco, Heimerdinger, and Rengar are able to dominate games; they are easy to play around, but it's a group effort. 

Shaco and Rengar are countered by good ward coverage and grouping. 

Tryndamere is countered by effective rotating. 

Heimerdinger is countered by good team fighting, outranging him in sieges, and quickly pushing objectives before he can set up camp. 

But, against an unorganized team who's members don't all participate in warding, don't communicate enough to know when to rotate, push, siege, take Epic Monster Objectives, or how to cohesively fight as a team, these champions are near unstoppable because their "effectiveness scales with the carelessness of their enemies." -Stonewall008

Trynd is obnoxious to play against, I will give you that.  His R is a HUGE denial button that cockblocks people who face him.

That said... he fits in just fine with all the other unfun piles of crap that have been shoveled at us lately.  Yasuo's dropping wind wall and negating your entire team's ranged attacks in a teamfight.  Tahm devouring a carry and fleeing at high speed.  Ekko pressing R and immediately getting himself out of the stupid position (and certain death) that he derped himself into.  Kalista pulling someone away from certain death, then kiting/chasing you to death with her infinite hops?  Kindred making everyone near her immune to death.  EVERY new champ lately has had some awful, unfun mechanics shoved into it that make people rage.  Trynd fits right in.  Hell, compared to them he's underpowered since he lacks 12 passives and % health true damage.  

Champs lately are becoming more and more binary.   Either you pick the champ who's thing invalidates THEIR thing... or they invalidate you and you're screwed.  Trynd isn't unfun.  The entire GAME is unfun... because that's the sort of interactions they're building it towards.
